articles.headline: Kremlin Cutting Economic Links With the Turks
articles.snippet: Russia was looking at ways to curb commercial ties and investment projects, possibly including the deal to build a gas pipeline through Turkey.
articles.abstract: Russia was looking at ways to curb commercial ties and investment projects, possibly including the deal to build a gas pipeline through Turkey.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — The downing of a Russian warplane by Turkey threatened to lead to a wholesale breach in the countries’ relations on Thursday, with the Kremlin preparing to sever economic ties and Turkish officials saying they had no reason to apologize.

articles.headline: Brazil Hedge Fund Star Looks Elsewhere for His Next Big Bet
articles.snippet: Luis Stuhlberger, whose fund has had a remarkable run in Brazil, has grown increasingly bearish about his country’s economic outlook.
articles.abstract: Luis Stuhlberger, whose fund has had a remarkable run in Brazil, has grown increasingly bearish about his country’s economic outlook.
articles.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil — Luis Stuhlberger’s Brazilian hedge fund has had an astonishing run — even in the face of his country’s sinking economy.

articles.headline: China Bars Anastasia Lin, Miss World Canada (and Rights Advocate)
articles.snippet: Miss Canada, Anastasia Lin, was denied a visa to attend the international pageant, apparently because she is outspoken about human-rights abuses in the country of her birth.
articles.abstract: Miss Canada, Anastasia Lin, was denied a visa to attend the international pageant, apparently because she is outspoken about human-rights abuses in the country of her birth.
articles.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — Clasping hands with youngsters in red Communist Youth League scarves, contestants from more than 110 nations descended on the southern Chinese island of Hainan this week for the 65th annual Miss World contest.

articles.headline: Macau Gambling Industry Faces Challenges on Multiple Fronts
articles.snippet: The once-booming gambling industry in Macau now confronts an array of obstacles, ranging from restrictive local policies to China’s economic slowdown and crackdown on corruption.
articles.abstract: The once-booming gambling industry in Macau now confronts an array of obstacles, ranging from restrictive local policies to China’s economic slowdown and crackdown on corruption.
articles.lead_paragraph: MACAU — Macau’s newest gambling palace has plenty to beckon deep-pocketed Chinese visitors looking for a good time.

articles.headline: Black Friday Retail Workers Try to Make the Most of a Shopping Slump
articles.snippet: Employees of companies like American Apparel will be putting in extra effort to turn around what is shaping up to be a dismal shopping season.
articles.abstract: Employees of companies like American Apparel will be putting in extra effort to turn around what is shaping up to be a dismal shopping season.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Black Friday, Jeffery Santos, 23, will rise at 4 a.m., grab a bagel and a strong espresso, jump on a train from the Bronx into Manhattan, and ready an American Apparel store on Broadway for its big 6 a.m. opening.

articles.headline: Open Season Is Seen in Gene Editing of Animals
articles.snippet: New techniques have made previously impossible goals fast and cheap enough for many to find worth pursuing.
articles.abstract: New techniques have made previously impossible goals fast and cheap enough for many to find worth pursuing.
articles.lead_paragraph: SIOUX CENTER, Iowa — Other than the few small luxuries afforded them, like private access to a large patch of grass, there was nothing to mark the two hornless dairy calves born last spring at a breeding facility here as early specimens in a new era of humanity’s dominion over nature.

articles.headline: Tighter Lid on Records Threatens to Weaken Government Watchdogs
articles.snippet: Investigations are being hampered by a dispute between the White House and its own watchdogs over the shrinking access of inspectors general to confidential files.
articles.abstract: Investigations are being hampered by a dispute between the White House and its own watchdogs over the shrinking access of inspectors general to confidential files.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Justice Department watchdogs ran into an unexpected roadblock last year when they began examining the role of federal drug agents in the fatal shootings of unarmed civilians during raids in Honduras.

articles.headline: Student Debt in America: Lend With a Smile, Collect With a Fist
articles.snippet: The story of how a teacher ended up $410,000 in debt reveals the deep contradictions in the federal government’s approach to student loans.
articles.abstract: The story of how a teacher ended up $410,000 in debt reveals the deep contradictions in the federal government’s approach to student loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: The American student loan crisis is often seen as a problem of profligacy and predation. Wasteful colleges raise tuition every year, we are told, even as middle-class wages stagnate and unscrupulous for-profit colleges bilk the unwary. The result is mounting unmanageable debt.

articles.headline: Financial Abuse of the Elderly: Sometimes Unnoticed, Always Predatory
articles.snippet: Exploiters are increasingly taking financial advantage of older adults, often through investments, contracts or other fraud.
articles.abstract: Exploiters are increasingly taking financial advantage of older adults, often through investments, contracts or other fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was only after Mariana Cooper, a widow in Seattle, found herself with strained finances that she confessed to her granddaughter that she was afraid she had been bilked out of much of her savings.
